title: Girl, 18, is found guilty of conspiring to stab to death her ex-boyfriend
text:
A Washington state jury has convicted an 18-year-old girl of plotting to kill a high school classmate she briefly dated.

Fe Hadley was found guilty on Monday for conspiracy to commit first-degree murder in a November 2017 planned attack.

Hadley denied conspiring with classmates Jeremiah Cunningham and Gabriel Pfliger to fatally stab 18-year-old Ryan Vaughn behind a store and hide his body in an orchard.

Scroll down for video

Fe Hadley, 18, was found guilty on Monday for conspiracy to commit first-degree murder. The Washington teen was accused of plotting to kill her ex-boyfriend Ryan Vaughn

Hadley's classmates and co-conspirator Jeremiah Cunningham testified against her at trial

Surveillance video shows Cunningham wearing a red mask and drawing a kitchen knife from his jacket on the day of the planned attack

After failing to lure Vaughn to his death, Cunningham headed to school, still wearing his red mask (pictured above)

Authorities say Vaughn never went behind the store after seeing a person in a red mask, later identified as Cunningham, lurking nearby, reported Tri-City Herald.

Other students riding scooters in the area noticed suspicious activity and alerted authorities.

During Hadley's week-long trial, prosecutors argued that the teen was angry at Vaughn for breaking up with her and concocted the murderous plot to get back at him.

Appearing as a witness for the prosecution, Cunningham described Hadley as the 'lure and leader' of the murder plot, but admitted that he was the one whose job it was to stab Vaughn.

Cunningham who, like Hadley, was 16 years old at the time, told the court that he was supposed to ambush Vaughn from behind, trip him, plunge a large kitchen knife into his chest, and then drag his body into a nearby ditch.

Cunningham and Hadley, who had been friends since grade school, dated for a short time, and the young man said he still had feelings for the girl at the time of the botched murder plot.

Hadley took the stand in her own defense on Friday, telling the jury that someone hacked her Facebook account and sent multiple messages to Vaughn asking him to meet her behind the Ki-Be Red Apple Market to talk.

Hadley claimed someone hacked her Facebook account and sent Vaughn messages asking him to meet with her. She also said it was Cunningham who wanted Vaughn dead

She also argued that it was Cunningham who came to her saying he was angry with Vaughn and wanted to kill him, but she did not believe him and thought he would just beat him up.

But another classmate testified that Hadley once bragged that her 'boyfriend' was going to murder Vaughn as a birthday present.

It took jurors less than three hours to convict Hadley on Monday evening. The teenage defendant showed no emotion when the guilty verdict was announced.

Hadley remains in custody on $100,000 bail pending her sentencing hearing, which is expected to be scheduled in the next month.

Cunningham and Pfliger pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit first-degree murder and second-degree assault with a deadly weapon, respectively.

Cunningham, who was charged as an adult, was sentenced to 10 years in prison. Pfliger, who was charged as a juvenile, was sentenced to 30 days in jail and community service.
description: Fe Hadley, from Washington state, was convicted on Monday of conspiracy to commit first-degree murder in a November 2017 planned attack on her ex-boyfriend Ryan Vaughn.
